notes: McKinney TX - 4 single-member districts. Mixed system: 4 district seats + 2 at-large + mayor at-large. Official city GIS (maps.mckinneytexas.org). Redistricted Nov 2022 with ~49,000 residents per district.

Grand Prairie TX - 6 single-member districts (Districts 1-6). Mixed system: 6 district seats + 2 at-large + mayor at-large. Official city GIS (gis.gptx.org). Split between Dallas and Tarrant counties.

source: City of Plano; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 7 council members elected at-large. Places 1-4 have residency requirements but all voters vote citywide. 4th largest city in DFW metro.

source: City of Mansfield; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large by place. Three-year staggered terms.

source: City of North Richland Hills; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 7 council members elected at-large. Council-Manager form adopted 1964.

source: City of Euless; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large. Three-year terms, place-based system.

source: City of Bedford; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large. Two-year terms for mayor. Council-Manager form.

source: City of Grapevine; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large. Three-year terms. Home Rule Charter adopted 1965.

source: City of Hurst; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: 7 council members elected at-large by place. Place 3 is Mayor. Two-year mayoral terms, place-based biennial elections.

source: City of Keller; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large. Three-year terms. Majority vote required.

source: City of Southlake; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large. Three-year staggered terms. Two-term limit.

source: City of Colleyville; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large. Three-year staggered terms.

source: City of Allen; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large citywide. Three-year staggered terms. Council-Manager form adopted 1979.

source: City of Wylie; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large. Three-year terms. City spans three counties (Collin, Dallas, Rockwall).

source: Town of Prosper; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large. Three-year terms. Home Rule Town. Pop ~42,600.

source: City of Celina; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large by place. Three-year terms. Home Rule since 1876.

source: City of Anna; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large by place. Three-year terms. Council-Manager form.

source: City of Murphy; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large by place. Three-year terms.

source: City of Princeton; Wave-S TX specialist
notes: Currently at-large, transitioning to hybrid in 2030. Mayor + 7 council seats. Seats 1-3 will remain at-large; Seats 4-7 will become single-member districts starting 2030. Home Rule Charter adopted Nov 2022.

Fort Worth already in registry (FIPS 4827000). Verified 2026-01-23: Service URL https://mapit.fortworthtexas.gov/ags/rest/services/CIVIC/OpenData_Boundaries/MapServer/2 is active. 10 districts (2-11) confirmed.
Arlington already in registry (FIPS 4804000). 5 single-member districts. Registry URL may need verification - connection timed out during test.
Frisco already in at-large registry. Mayor + 6 council members elected at-large. Fastest growing large city in Texas.
